aas:langStringTextType.aas:text: defaultAdminShell
This model acts as Shared Aspect and should not be assigned to a digital twin. Use for example SecondaryMaterialContentCalculated or SecondaryMaterialContentVerifiable instead.
List of relevant materials, which are built in this part and details on the share of primary and secondary material.
List of relevant materials, which are built in this part and details on the share of primary and secondary material.
Material name according to standard.
Attribute to define the measure and actual mass of the material.
Bio-based materials are materials of biological origin excluding material embedded in geological formations and/or fossilized.
Secondary materials are recycled materials that can be used in manufacturing processes instead of or alongside virgin raw materials.
Primary materials are raw materials that are used for the first time during the planned process.
Material based on inorganic matter or fossil fuels.
Secondary materials are recycled materials that can be used in manufacturing processes instead of or alongside virgin raw materials.

Amount of material that is Pre-consumer material. Material diverted from the waste stream during a manufacturing process. Excluded is reutilization of materials such as rework, regrind or scrap generated in a process and capable of being reclaimed within the same process that generated it. Pre-consumer material can be used in form of recovered or recycled material as a substitute for primary material.
Materials that have undergone mechanical recycling.

Amount of material that is Post-consumer material. Material generated by households or by commercial, industrial and institutional facilities in their role as end-users of the product which can no longer be used for ist intended purpose. This includes returns of material from the distribution chain. Post-consumer material can be used in form of recovered or recycled material as a substitute for primary material.
Materials that have undergone mechanical recycling.
Materials that have undergone chemical recycling.

Material generated by households or by commercial, industrial and institutional facilities in their role as end-users of END OF LIFE VEHICLES which can no longer be used for its intended purpose. This includes returns of material from the distribution chain.
This attribute ONLY contains post consume material which originates from the automotive industry. All other material must be included in "post consumer".
Materials that have undergone chemical recycling.
Materials that have undergone mechanical recycling.
Primary materials are raw materials that are used for the first time during the planned process.
If available, the name of a certificate verifying the recycling content can be included.
If available, the name of a certificate verifying the recycling content can be included.
This model acts as Shared Aspect and should not be assigned to a digital twin. Use for example SecondaryMaterialContentCalculated or SecondaryMaterialContentVerifiable instead.

aas:langStringDefinitionTypeIec61360.aas:text: This model acts as Shared Aspect and should not be assigned to a digital twin. Use for example SecondaryMaterialContentCalculated or SecondaryMaterialContentVerifiable instead.
Material class according to VDA standard 231-106.
Norm authority which governs norm.
Id of standard used by norming authority.
Name of the material according to the norming authority and the referenced ID of the norm.
Material name according to standard.
Unit of measure in which the mass of the material is measured.
Net mass of material in defined unit.
Gross Material Input Mass in defined unit. (german: "Bruttomaterialeinsatzgewicht").
Attribute to define the measure and actual mass of the material.
Information on bio-based material class.

Information whether mass-balancing was applied: Mass balance is one of several well-known chain of custody approaches that can be used to track the flow of materials through the value chain. The total quantity of the content in question is tracked through the production system and the allocation of this content is made to the end products based on verifiable accounting.
Share of the full material weight in percentage.
Secondary materials are recycled materials that can be used in manufacturing processes instead of or alongside virgin raw materials.
Share of the full material weight in percentage.
Primary materials are raw materials that are used for the first time during the planned process.
Bio-based materials are materials of biological origin excluding material embedded in geological formations and/or fossilized.
Share of the full material weight in percentage.

Information whether mass-balancing was applied: Mass balance is one of several well-known chain of custody approaches that can be used to track the flow of materials through the value chain. The total quantity of the content in question is tracked through the production system and the allocation of this content is made to the end products based on verifiable accounting.
Materials that have undergone mechanical recycling.

Excluded is reutilization of materials such as rework, regrind or scrap generated in a process and capable of being reclaimed within the same process that generated it. Pre-consumer material can be used in form of recovered or recycled material as a substitute for primary material.

The total quantity of the content in question is tracked through the production system and the allocation of this content is made to the end products based on verifiable accounting.

This includes returns of material from the distribution chain. Post-consumer material can be used in form of recovered or recycled material as a substitute for primary material.

The total quantity of the content in question is tracked through the production system and the allocation of this content is made to the end products based on verifiable accounting.

The total quantity of the content in question is tracked through the production system and the allocation of this content is made to the end products based on verifiable accounting.

Material generated by households or by commercial, industrial and institutional facilities in their role as end-users of END OF LIFE VEHICLES which can no longer be used for its intended purpose. This includes returns of material from the distribution chain.
This attribute ONLY contains post consume material which originates from the automotive industry. All other material must be included in "post consumer".
Secondary materials are recycled materials that can be used in manufacturing processes instead of or alongside virgin raw materials.
Share of the full material weight in percentage.
Primary materials are raw materials that are used for the first time during the planned process.
Material based on inorganic matter or fossil fuels.
If available, the name of a certificate verifying the recycling content can be included.
The certificate can be referenced for example as a PDF file.
If available, the name of a certificate verifying the recycling content can be included.

This attribute can be used to add additional information on material level. For example could this field contain information about how much material has been reutilized. Reutilization of materials such as rework, regrind, or scrap materials generated within the process and capable of being reused within the same process that generated it.
List of relevant materials, which are built in this part and details on the share of primary and secondary material.
Order number as provided by supplier.
